trans-unit.source: Enable: Enable this if you want to include google-analytics on your site.
Tracking ID / Web Property ID: The tracking ID / web property ID. The format is UA-XXXX-Y. All collected data is associated by this ID.
Tracker Name: Name of the tracker object (optional).
Anonymize IP: When present, the IP address of the sender will be anonymized.
Page exclude: Set page-IDs (commaseparated list) where the tracking code should not be used.
Force CDN: Force the use of the external analytics-script from Google's CDN.

Disable if BE-session is active: Enable this if you want to include the script only if there is no backend-user logged in (Be aware that this will add the condition 'beUserLogin' which will influence site-caching!).
Use alternative script: Enable alternative async tracking snippet for use in modern browsers (see: https://developers.google.com/analytics/devguides/collection/analyticsjs/).

Name of the ga object: In some cases you'd like to add analytics.js to your page, but the 'ga' variable is already being used for something else. To deal with this, analytics.js provides a mechanism for renaming the global 'ga' object.

Script-Tag for Cookie Consent: To use this extension with cookie consent, enter a script-tag here which will be added as "data-SCRIPTTAG". If not empty, all external scripts are added with "data-src" instead of "src".
URL to Google-Analytics: URL to Google-Analytics javascript (analytics.js)
Local javascript-file: Path to the local javascript-file of Google-Analytic (relative to PATH_site).
Force external file: Enable this if you want to force the use of the original file from Google's CDN.
Update analytics.js from Google's CDN
Update the Google-Analytics JavaScript tracking snippet.
